item.title: Create A Bear Quest Guide In Disney Dreamlight Valley
item.description:
Create a Bear is triggered after you complete Joy's final quest, Dream a Little Dream, since both emotions are connected in Disney Dreamlight Valley . During this quest, the ruler will work out their emotions with Sadness and reveal a hidden memory that was long forgotten.

Memory Fragments Locations In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

Upon triggering the Build a Bear quest, which is Sadness' final friendship quest in Disney Dreamlight Valley , speak with Sadness, who wishes to help you work through your emotions. First, players must locate three memory fragments scattered throughout the valley by following the given hints, such as heading to a place that connects many worlds in DDV .

Memory Fragment Location Hint

Location

Outside somewhere you feel at home

Around the players' house.

A place that connects many worlds

Inside the Dreamlight Castle.

Where Joy and Sadness control emotions

Go to the Inside Out Realm in the HQ room.

Once all three memory fragments are found, use the console in the HQ room to spawn a screen. You need to use the sections on the console to rearrange your memory in DDV .

How To Use The Sections On The Console To Rearrange Your Memory In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

To rearrange your memory in Disney Dreamlight Valley , use the left, middle, and right sections on the console . Dreamers must arrange the fragments in a way that reveals what happened to the ruler a long time ago. To put it simply, if you wish to solve the puzzle quickly, press the left section three times, the middle one once, and the right section twice .

Read the Lost Diary Page and return to Sadness to discuss the memory. The next step is to collect all the required materials to craft a New Comfort Bear by combining the old pieces with the materials in DDV .

How To Complete The Create A Bear Quest In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

Complete the Create a Bear quest in Disney Dreamlight Valley by crafting the New Comfort Bear and decorating its own space in the valley. Here are all the materials dreamers need to gather:

  • Forgotten Lands

  • Glade of Trust

  • Forgotten Lands

Craft the Special Plush Bear Sewing Machine and the Framework to unlock the New Comfort Bear recipe. Place the giant stuffed bear anywhere in the valley and seek Sadness to show it to her.

Decorate the surrounding space with blue and yellow items to take a picture with the Inside Out characters and complete the Create a Bear quest. As a reward, you receive "In Your Feelings" Overalls and a Basic Plush Bear touch of magic item to make your own version.

item.title: 5 Best Open-World Games Where Stealth Is More Fun Than Combat, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games now require action-packed gameplay to engage fans effectively.
  • Most open-world games offer combat and stealth mechanics for player enjoyment.
  • Stealth gameplay shines in titles like Watch Dogs 2, Assassin's Creed Syndicate, and Metal Gear Solid 5.

Open-world gaming has progressed by leaps and bounds over the past decade. The simple act of exploring a sandbox isn't enough for a game to ingratiate itself to most fans these days. Gamers are now expecting some form of action-packed gameplay to keep themselves occupied.

Most open-world games pair straightforward combat with stealth mechanics to add more gameplay loops for fans to enjoy. In some cases, sneaking around is so much fun that players prefer taking out enemies silently instead of getting in an opponent's face. For players who love the stealth approach, these titles are a perfect fit.

5 Watch Dogs 2

Players Have Many Options When It Comes To Stealth

Watch Dogs 2 addresses the many complaints fans had over the first game, most of which were legitimate. Aiden's story was too dark, the hacking mechanics weren't utilized to their fullest extent, and prioritizing action-packed combat went against the idea of being a hacker who can debilitate enemies without leaving a trace.

This is something fans can enjoy in Watch Dogs 2 . The sequel adopts a more jovial tone, gives players non-lethal options, and makes a player's hacking skills more viable in stealth. This incentivizes players to fight from the shadows, especially since combat isn't all that interesting, since players just interact with basic third-person shooting gameplay.

4 Assassin's Creed Syndicate

Combat Is Somewhat Floaty, But Stealth Is Satisfying

Assassin's Creed Syndicate

It's a shame that Assassin's Creed Syndicate 's low sales marked a turning point for the franchise, since most people would agree that Victorian London is one of the most tantalizing settings fans of the series can enjoy. Both Jacob and Evie Frye are great characters to control, and most people will ultimately prefer controlling the latter, since she's more adept in stealthy situations. Problematic gender norms aside, there are many reasons Evie Frye is more fun to control than her reckless brother.

While combat is fun in its own right, it feels like a pale imitation of the Arkham games and lacks the smooth animations that made Rocksteady's titles so much fun to play. It almost feels janky to engage with the combat loop for too long. Instead, most players prefer going invisible as Evie once players unlock her ultimate skill, allowing her to stay hidden even though enemies are staring right at her, which is more entertaining than fans would assume.

3 Deus Ex: Mankind Divided

The approach to an open-world hub in the form of Prague helps Mankind Divided stand out. It's a shame that poor executive decisions led to the conversations around the game surrounding its rushed release, microtransactions, and an unfinished ending. Players who manage to look past these issues will enjoy a tight gameplay loop that lets Adam Jensen shine in both stealth and combat.

While cover shooting and close-range takedowns are fun to execute, any Deus Ex fan will attest that stealth is where these games shine. Mankind Divided is no exception. Players can land hard-hitting takedowns from the shadows, hack machines to aid them instead of enemies, and use silent weapons to efficiently take out opponents. These are just some of the many ways stealth is a blast to engage with in Mankind Divided .

2 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Skyrim is notable for many things, and promoting player freedom is a huge reason why players went gaga over this title. Players can become warriors, mages, thieves, or combine the best qualities of different classes to become more powerful than ever. Stealth received a major upgrade in this title from previous Elder Scrolls games. Players loved to shoot enemies from the shadows to enjoy the Sneak Damage bonus, which can potentially one-shot enemies.

This eventually leads to players becoming stealth archers who prefer sneaking once they detect enemies nearby. It has become such a popular Skyrim play style that people make jokes about it and have to make a conscious effort not to revert to the same build that they all gravitated towards during their first playthrough. Sure, using magic and bursting into hostile areas with powerful melee weapons is fun in its own right, but stealth archery is so efficient that players will miss seeing enemies drop one by one as they fail to figure out where their mysterious assailant is hiding.

Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain is one of the best video games ever made, and it's a shame that Kojima left the company before he could finish the title's story. However, players who want to engage with the gameplay side of things will love what The Phantom Pain brings to the table. The stealth gameplay is more refined than ever before and gives players a ton of options to mess around with when sneaking around enemy bases.

Using decoys to distract enemies, sneaking around in Snake's iconic cardboard box, and taking out enemies before they raise the alarm is a huge part of what makes stealth in The Phantom Pain so special. Sure, there are encounters where players are forced into direct confrontations, but these moments aren't too frequent and don't take away from the immaculate stealth gameplay that makes every mission a joy to undertake.

item.title: How to Beat Reborn Treant Soulwood Boss in Wuchang Fallen Feathers
item.description:
Wuchang Fallen Feathers features a wide range of boss fights, some being optional, while most of them are mandatory to progress the story. Reborn Treant Soulwood is one of the main bosses that you'll encounter towards the end of the Doomwillow Beach section in chapter one. The boss towers over Wuchang and can summon corpses and wood tentacles to halt her movement. Here's how to easily beat this boss and progress further into the story.

All Reborn Treant Soulwood Attacks

Reborn Treant Soulwood in Wuchang Fallen Feathers is a rather sluggish boss with repetitive attacks that players can easily dodge away from (after going a few rounds with it). Let's break down all the attacks you can expect from the boss in this encounter and how to counter/evade them.

  • AOE Flame Attack : The boss will lower its head and charge up a fiery attack in its mouth. Once the attack is released, flame will cover 90% of the boss arena and will inflict burn damage to Wuchang if she's caught in it. To avoid getting hit by this attack, players can either dodge at the last second when flames reach Wuchang or they can move farthest away from the boss, as the flames won't reach there.
  • Inhale (Air Pull) : The boss will randomly perform an inhale attack, which will pull players towards it and into the pool of rot (Despair). The pool will quickly build the Despair ailment, which will cause immediate death. So, while the boss is doing this attack, keep sprinting away from it to maintain your distance.
  • Energy Projectiles (Orbs) : At random intervals, Reborn Treant Soulwood will launch two to three orb projectiles that will hone in on Wuchang. Dodging them at the last second is recommended to build Skyborn Might. Once these hit the ground, they'll create flowers that will provide additional Skyborn Might.
  • Ground Slam : This is a simple attack and not very dangerous, as the boss will simply slam one of its fists into the ground. The first will get stuck in the ground, giving players ample time to hurt it with melee weapons.
  • Minion Summon : Throughout the encounter, the boss will summon corpses that will grab hold of Wuchang's leg, restricting her mobility for a short duration. On the other hand, the boss can also summon wood tentacles that can spin around and inflict damage to Wuchang.

How to Beat Reborn Treant Soulwood in Wuchang Fallen Feathers

Players can beat the Reborn Treant Soulwood boss in either a safe but slow way, or the hard and quick way in Wuchang Fallen Feathers . While the former will require you to rely on spells and maintain your distance from the boss, the latter will need you to get up close and use melee weapons against it.

For the first method, players can use fire-based spells like Infernal Flames or Burning Flames against the boss. Simply keep dodging the boss' attacks at the right moment to build up enough Skyborn Might. Once you get an opportunity, launch the fire-based spells from an effective distance to engulf the boss in flames, dealing a decent amount of damage.

If you're interested in the second method, it's recommended to use the Bone Needle - Flame Temperance to imbue your weapon with fire. This method is a bit risky, but you'll need to essentially keep dodging attacks and wait for the boss to use the Ground Slam attack. Once the boss' fist is stuck in the ground, launch an all-out attack on it to inflict high damage against the Reborn Treant Soulwood.

For best efficiency, it's recommended to combine both of the methods mentioned above to quickly beat the Reborn Treant Soulwood boss in Wuchang Fallen Feathers . Once the boss is defeated, you'll get an Alltree Jade Cylinder item and the Echo of Soulwood spell.

item.title: Steam Deck-Like Gaming Handheld Displays in 3D Without Glasses, But It's Not Cheap
item.description:
Gaming handheld manufacturer Abxylute is selling a new handheld that's like a mash-up between the Nintendo 3DS's naked-eye 3D display and a Steam Deck. However, if players want the new Steam Deck-like, they will have to spend nearly $2,000 for the device.

Prior to VR headsets like the Meta Quest becoming more mainstream, 3D saw an increase in popularity, primarily in movies and TV. Nintendo capitalized on this with its unique 3DS handheld, which had a 3D pop-out effect that didn't require glasses. Most 3D gaming offerings have since shifted to VR, but this new handheld may remind fans of the 3DS days.

New Steam Deck-Like Handheld is in 3D

Abxylute is introducing the Abxylute 3D One, a handheld gaming console with a whopping 11-inch screen, detachable controllers, and a glasses-free 3D display. The system features an Intel Lunar Lake chip, 32 GB of LPDDR5X RAM, and its 11-inch display has a 2560x1600 resolution with a 120Hz refresh rate. According to The Verge, the Abxylute 3D One is optimized to "deliver 3D for 50 of the top Steam games," including Black Myth: Wukong and Hogwarts Legacy . It also includes conversion software to turn images and video into 3D.

The Abxylute 3D One won't come cheap, as it will go on sale in September or October for "under $1,700." It reportedly uses eye-tracking to achieve a 3D effect, which is a bit different from the Nintendo 3DS. The removable controllers may make one think of the Nintendo Switch, but these thankfully use hall effect joysticks and triggers, which should help to prevent the dreaded stick drift. It also features twin touchpads, similar to the Steam Deck. Due to its large size and relatively heavy weight at 2.45 pounds, it features a kickstand, so users don't have to hold the entire system all the time.

The price of the Abxylute 3D One is notably much higher than the Steam Deck or the Nintendo Switch 2, with the Steam Deck ranging from $399 to $649, depending on the model, and the Nintendo Switch 2 base system selling for $449.99. However, if the Abxylute 3D One can deliver the experience it's promising, the price is fairly understandable. The Steam Deck has a 1280 x 800 resolution on its 7.4-inch screen, while the Switch 2 maxes at 1920x1080 on its 7.9-inch screen, and neither have 3D effects. With more handheld systems that deliver console or PC-like experiences entering the market, the Abxylute 3D One has carved out an interesting niche that could help propel it to popularity.

item.title: Dream A Little Dream Quest Guide In Disney Dreamlight Valley
item.description:
Complete Joy's final friendship quest, Dream a Little Dream, in Disney Dreamlight Valley to eventually get a cute outfit with a matching hat. The quest will dive deeper into the ruler's forgotten memory that caused a cloud of sadness to loom over the valley.

How To Trigger The Dream A Little Dream Quest In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

The Dream a Little Dream quest is triggered by completing Sadness' third friendship quest in DDV as well as reaching friendship level 10 with Joy. Speak with both emotions to be sent on a mission and collect some materials to recreate the ruler's forgotten memory.

Grab the Spotlights from the mail and then head to the Inside Out realm to get the rest. In the HQ, go to the top left corner of the room near the shelves of documents to find the Dream Documentation. Next, travel to the Dream Production set and grab the Dream Camera and pot of Green Paint.

Give the Dream Documentation to Belle and ask her to be the screenwriter, and then craft a Camera Lens Filter. You will need the following gems:

  • Forgotten Lands

Next, head to the secret chamber in the Frosted Heights and place all the equipment, then attach the lens to the Dream Camera to start the Dream Production. After setting everything up, seek The Forgotten and ask them if they would like to act in the production.

After the first scene plays out, some of the spotlights explode, and dreamers need to collect the fallen Glass and make three Light Bulbs to replace them. Now, Joy tasks players with changing the lighting depending on the scene's mood in DDV .

How To Find The Right Mood And Change The Lighting In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

To complete the Dream a Little Dream quest, you need to use three light buttons to control the lighting of the Dream Production. Just keep in mind that colors can mix to create a new one. Follow these steps:

  • To find the right mood for the start of the scene, change the lighting to yellow by pressing the yellow button .
  • To find the right mood for the middle of the scene, change the lighting to blue by turning off the yellow and pressing the blue button .
  • To find the right mood for the end of the scene, change the lighting to purple by keeping the blue on and pressing the red button next .

Grab the Yellow Plush Bear Yarn and talk to Joy to end the quest and get the Joyful Retro Outfit and Joyful Retro Hat as rewards.
